Install on windows Bash
-----------------------

1- Download and default install Node.Js
2- Open Windows bash and type: sudo su
apt-get install -y nodejs. (which npm should give sth like /usr/bin/npm)

To update npm and nodejs:
sudo apt-get purge npm
sudo npm cache clean -f
sudo npm install -g n
sudo n stable

3- npm install -g gulp-cli
if gulp -v returns "/usr/bin/env: node: No such file or directory"   do ln -s /usr/bin/nodejs /usr/bin/node
4- sudo npm install -g bower
5- Go to the project folder cd my_project/ and do gulp init (only the first time)
   (Gulp needs 2 files at the root: gulpfile.js, package.json)
5- Do npm install fom npm to install the dependencies listed in package.json in 'devDependencies'
6- to use css autoprefixer you may need to add 'require('es6-promise').polyfill();' at the beginning of the gulpfile


Get a Gulp project running from Github
--------------------------------------

- Git clone
- npm install (install deps from package.json)
- gulp


Start a new Gulp project
------------------------

- npm install --save-dev gulp gulp-autoprefixer gulp-bower gulp-cssbeautify gulp-csso gulp-include gulp-load gulp-rename gulp-replace gulp-sass gulp-uglify
- Update a few packages if you get errors... e.g. npm update browser-sync
- if you have 'ReferenceError: Promise is not defined' from autoprefixer module, add 'require('es6-promise').polyfill();' at the beginning of gulpfile.
If you have this error: ' Error: Missing binding node_modules/gulp-sass/node_modules/node-sass/vendor/linux-x64-51/binding.node
Node Sass could not find a binding for your current environment: Linux 64-bit with Node.js 7.x'
then go to https://github.com/sass/node-sass-binaries and download the bin that was mentioned in error and create place it where it says in error.

If you get the error:
  gulpInst.start.apply(gulpInst, toRun);
  TypeError: Cannot read property 'apply' of undefined
  then do:
  npm install -g npm@2.4.0
  npm install -g npm@latest
  npm install -g "gulpjs/gulp-cli#4.0"
